title: Miles Davis-Seven Steps 1963-64-D1~7-2004[EAC - FLAC](oan)
description:
Miles Davis-Seven Steps Complete 1963-64-D1~7-2004[EAC - FLAC](oan)


By John Kelman


Miles Davis

Seven Steps: The Complete Columbia Recordings Of Miles Davis, 1963-1964
Columbia Legacy 2004

Eagerly anticipated, Seven Steps: The Complete Columbia Recordings of Miles
Davis 1963-1964 documents the emergence of Miles' second great quintet,
featuring saxophonist Wayne Shorter, pianist Herbie Hancock, bassist Ron Carter
and drummer Tony Williams. It demonstrates, over the course of seven discs and
seven hours, how critical each member of that quintet was. As the group coalesces
over a period of two years it's tangible how everything falls into place, like a set of
tumblers on a complicated lock.



Personnel


Miles Davis (trumpet), Ron Carter (bass), George Coleman (tenor saxophone on
discs 1-5), Victor Feldman (piano on disc 1), Frank Butler (drums on disc 1), Herbie
Hancock (piano on discs 2-7), Tony Williams (drums on discs 2-7), Sam Rivers
(tenor saxophone on disc 6), Wayne Shorter (tenor saxophone on disc 7)






1. (05:27) - Joshua
2. (06:47) - I Fall In Love Too Easily
3. (08:28) - Baby Won't You Please Come Home
4. (05:14) - So Near, So Far
5. (10:29) - Basin Street Blues
6. (05:31) - Seven Steps To Heaven (Take 3)
7. (06:13) - Seven Steps To Heaven (Take 5)
8. (06:01) - Summer Night
